CatDescriptText: Irma Robertson, 2560 Breckenridge Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "The beating of a colored man by several whites a short time ago, and other incidents similar to this could be the start of something which would be very bad for Pittsburgh.  Whenever you find a bunch of hoodlums attacking a man for no apparent reason at all there must be tension."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Irma Robertson wearing light colored coat, holding basket and "Pittsburgh Courier" newspaper, standing with reporter holding notepad, on Liberty Avenue with Dimlings Candy in background, Downtown
